BodyName: Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Health, Committee on Hospitals and the Committee on Education

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Health, Committee on Hospitals and the Committee on Education
Oversight - School-Based Health Centers and School-Based Mental Health Clinics.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - School-Based Health Centers and School-Based Mental Health Clinics.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city department of education to report the number of students reported to the office of school health as having a diagnosis of sickle cell disease or trait
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYC DOE to report the number of students reported to the office of school health as having a diagnosis of sickle cell disease or trait.

Items.Title: Resolution designating the second Friday in March annually as Social and Emotional Learning Day in the City of New York and recognizing the importance of ensuring that prekindergarten through twelfth grade public school students acquire the social-emotional competencies needed to succeed in life.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Designating the second Friday in March annually as Social and Emotional Learning Day in the City of New York.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Joseph, Narcisse, Schulman, Menin, Paladino, Ariola, Zhuang, Marmorato, Feliz, Hanks, Gennaro, Moya, Sanchez, Brewer, Brooks-Powers, Gutierrez, Krishnan, Dinowitz, Yeger and Public Advocate Williams.

Items.Title: Oversight - School-Based Health Centers and School-Based Mental Health Clinics.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - School-Based Health Centers and School-Based Mental Health Clinics.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city department of education to report the number of students reported to the office of school health as having a diagnosis of sickle cell disease or trait
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYC DOE to report the number of students reported to the office of school health as having a diagnosis of sickle cell disease or trait.

Items.Title: Resolution designating the second Friday in March annually as Social and Emotional Learning Day in the City of New York and recognizing the importance of ensuring that prekindergarten through twelfth grade public school students acquire the social-emotional competencies needed to succeed in life.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
